course_title: Research Topics in Political Science: Repression/ControlDictatorship
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 40 / Seats Avail: 35Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course will be taught entirely online and will meet synchronously both days.


This three-credit course is an advanced research seminar with a focus on state repression and control in dictatorships. We investigate why dictators employ state repression, the ways in which they do so (including censorship, purges, and mass violence), and the institutions they use to carry out repression (e.g., secret police, courts). We also discuss the legacy of state repression for society and regime stability.
course_description: Research on selected topics and problems in political science. Class will fulfill the "research" requirement for the political science major. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: POLS 208 or POLS_OX 208 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
